Comcast is a global media and technology company that reaches customers, viewers and guests worldwide . We deliver broadband, wireless, video and voice services primarily under the Xfinity, Comcast Business, Sky and NOW brands . We produce, distribute and stream leading entertainment, sports and news through brands including NBC, Telemundo, Universal, Peacock and Sky .
 There can be no assurance that a separation transaction will occur, or, if one does occur, of its terms or timing . We are targeting to complete the Spin-off by the end of 2025, subject to the satisfaction of customary conditions, including obtaining final approval from our Board of Directors . We offer services to customers individually and as bundled services at a discounted rate .
 In 2024, we began offering prepaid domestic broadband services with downstream speeds of up to 200 megabits per second marketed under the NOW brand . We earn commission revenue from the sale of DTC streaming services when sold with our broadband services or through our video platforms, including X1 and Sky Q . We also offer monthly access to our network of Wi-Fi hotspots .
 Comcast 2024 Annual Report on Form 10-K: We offer wireless services for wireless handsets, tablets and smart watches (“wireless devices”) We offer video services to residential and business customers primarily through our X1 platform in the United States over our network . In 2024, we began offering prepaid unlimited data plans marketed under the NOW brand .
 Sky offers a range of video packages from basic linear service to full linear service . Customers may also subscribe to digital video recorder services or access our video on demand services . Now services provide video content over the internet and do not require a set-top box . Sky also offer DTC streaming services marketed under the NOW brand, with an offering in the United States that launched in 2023 .
 We also offer video services in the United Kingdom and Italy over a broadband connection without the need for a satellite dish . These services have an operating system similar to Sky Q and are offered to customers through Sky Stream, which leverages a streaming device and Wi-Fi, or to customers that purchase our Sky Glass smart televisions . We generally receive an allocation of scheduled advertising time that our advertising business sells .
 Our domestic broadband offerings have a range of service levels, including fiber-based services that deliver symmetrical speeds ranging up to 100 gigabits per second . Larger enterprises may also receive support services related to Wi-Fi networks, router management, network security, business continuity risks and other services . These services are primarily provided to Fortune 1000 companies and other large enterprises with multiple locations .
 We leverage DOCSIS 3.1 to offer up to gigabit-plus downstream broadband speeds . We also deploy fiber-to-the-premises with symmetrical speed offerings ranging up to 10 gigabits per second to residential customers . We offer domestic wireless services using an MVNO agreement that allows us to offer services using Verizon’s wireless network along with our existing network of Wi-Fi hotspots .
 The components of our domestic network require periodic maintenance and replacement . We offer broadband and wireline voice services in the United Kingdom and Italy using third-party networks . For a majority of international customers, our video platform is delivered via one-way digital satellite transmission that uses satellites leased from third parties for the distribution of television networks .
 The ranges of service levels and speeds we offer are dependent upon the capabilities and reach of these third-party networks . We offer wireless services in the United Kingdom using a combination of a third party’s network and our own mobile core network . We also continue to focus on leveraging our own cloud network services to deliver video and advanced search capabilities .
 The programming on our Sky-branded entertainment television networks includes content licensed from third parties and from our Studios segment, including certain original content . We purchase from a limited number of suppliers a significant amount of customer premise equipment, including wireless gateways and set-top boxes, network equipment, and services to provide our broadband and video services to residential and business customers .
 Some companies have built and are continuing to build fiber-based wireline networks, such as AT&T, Frontier, and Verizon in the U.S. The availability of these and other offerings could negatively impact the demand for our domestic broadband services, the authors say . Other companies have launched new technologies, including 5G and 4G wireless networks, they say .
 We compete with a number of companies offering video services in the Connectivity & Platforms markets, including: DTC streaming service providers and aggregators . We also compete with companies offering free-to-air networks, such as broadcast television stations, and fiber-based networks that provide video services similar to ours . The company's Sky-branded entertainment television networks compete for the distribution of our television network programming .
 We compete for the sale of advertising with digital properties, including an increasing number of ad-supported DTC streaming service providers and other online content providers . We also compete with companies offering technology, tools and other services to customers in the media industry . Our advertising is sold to local, regional and national advertisers, and competition is affected by the market conditions in the specific geographic locations in which we operate .
 Media segment includes NBCUniversal’s national and regional cable networks, NBC and Telemundo broadcast networks and owned local broadcast television stations . Media revenue is subject to cyclical patterns and changes in viewership levels, driven by timing of the winter holiday season, political campaigns, sports seasons and when programming is aired .
 NBCUniversal operates a diversified portfolio of cable networks operating predominantly in the United States . The table below presents a summary of NBCUniversal’s national cable networks and their advertising reach to U.S. households . We also generate revenue from the licensing of our owned content and technology and from various digital properties .
 The NBC network features original entertainment, news and sports programming that reaches viewers in virtually all U.S. television households . Our regional sports networks serve approximately 11 million households across the United States . The Telemundo network, a Spanish-language broadcast network, reached viewers in over 96% of all . Hispanic television households through 122 affiliated stations, including our 30 owned Telemund local broadcast television stations, and our national feed .
 Peacock is our DTC streaming service, featuring NBCUniversal and third-party content . Programming choices include exclusive originals, current NBC, Bravo and Telemundo shows, news, late-night comedy, live sports and a library of television shows and movies . We operate a diversified portfolio of international television networks, including premium sports networks in the UK and Italy .
 eacock include content licensed from our Studios segment and from third parties . We generally seek to include in our sports rights agreements the rights to distribute content on one or more of our television networks and on digital properties, including Peacock . We have various multiyear agreements for the licensing of content, including contracts related to television and/or streaming rights .
 omcast 2024 Annual Report on Form 10-K - 10:888 . Includes rights to produce and distribute on NBC and on Peacock a specified number of NBA and WNBA regular season and playoff games . NFL games are also distributed in the Spanish language on Universo or Telemundo . Agreement expires after the 2033-34 season .
 Revenue is generated primarily from the worldwide licensing of our owned film and television content . We also generate revenue from the sale of physical and digital home entertainment products . We distribute the majority of our films initially for exhibition in movie theaters, while other films are initially distributed through licensing agreements . We license films, including recent films and selections from our film library, which is comprised of more than 6,500 movies .
 Theatrical revenue is significantly affected by the timing of each release and the number of films we distribute . Success of a film in movie theaters is generally a significant factor in determining the revenue a film is likely to generate in succeeding licensing windows and through physical and digital home entertainment product sales . Investors generally assume the full risks and rewards of ownership proportionate to their ownership in the film .
 Comcast 2024 Annual Report on Form 10-K: Television studios develop, produce and distribute original content, including scripted and unscripted television series . We also produce television content jointly as co-producers with third-party studios and production companies . Our original content is primarily initially licensed to linear television networks and DTC streaming service providers, including those in our Media and Residential Connectivity & Platforms segments .
 Universal Beijing Resort is owned by us and a consortium of Chinese state-owned companies . Universal Kids Resort, a smaller-scale theme park in Frisco, Texas expected to open in 2026; and Universal Horror Unleashed, a year-round horror entertainment experience in Las Vegas, Nevada expected in 2025 . Universal Studios Japan is a theme park located in Osaka, Japan .
 Our Media segment competes for viewers’ attention and audience share with all forms of programming provided to viewers . The willingness of advertisers to purchase advertising from us may be adversely affected by lower audience ratings . Declines in audience ratings can be caused by increased competition for the leisure time of viewers and by audience fragmentation resulting from the increasing number and forms of entertainment .
 Peacock competes for subscribers primarily with other DTC streaming service providers . Our studios compete to obtain creative, performing and technical talent, including writers, actors, directors, and producers . We also compete with other major film and television studios and other producers of entertainment content for exhibition of content in theaters, on demand, on television networks .
 The competitive position of our theme parks primarily depends on the quality and popularity of rides and attractions . There is increased competition in areas with high concentrations of theme parks and other attractions operated by several companies . Macroeconomic conditions and other factors may also result in shifting consumer preferences toward other types of destinations, experiences and products .
 Revenue in Studios fluctuates due to the timing, nature and number of films released in movie theaters, through DTC streaming services and viewing on demand, and on physical and digital home entertainment products . Revenue from our television studios fluctuates in part due to a correlation with the broadcast network season beginning annually in September . Revenue in Theme Parks fluctuates with changes in theme park attendance .
 Our businesses are subject to various federal, state, local, and international laws and regulations . The Communications Act of 1934, as amended, and Federal Communications Commission rules and regulations affect significant aspects of our communications businesses . State legislative and regulatory initiatives can create a patchwork of different and/or conflicting state requirements . Applying existing laws in novel ways to new technologies, including streaming services and artificial intelligence, may also affect our business .
 Congress has approved tens of billions of dollars in new funding for broadband deployment and adoption initiatives . Federal agencies have considered adopting new regulations for communications services, including broadband . States and localities are increasingly proposing new regulations impacting communications services . Regulators in various international jurisdictions are similarly considering changes to telecommunications and media requirements . Any of these regulations could significantly affect our business and our legal and compliance costs .
 In 2024, the FCC reclassified broadband internet access services as a “telecommunications service” subject to traditional common carriage regulation under Title II of the Communications Act . A federal appellate court in 2025 overturned that reclassification . States and localities have in the past enacted and may in the future periodically consider new broadband-related regulations .
 A number of municipalities operate municipally owned broadband networks, and there may be further efforts by local governments to expand or create government-owned networks . We cannot predict how and to whom any such funds will be awarded, when the initiatives will be terminated or the impact of these initiatives on our businesses . We are subject to laws and regulations that apply to our cable services .
 The FCC and other federal agencies can impact the programming networks that we carry, as well as how we price, package, bill and market our video services . FCC regulations also require cable operators to carry programming transmitted by certain local broadcast television stations . The FCC enforces these rules on a case-by-case basis based on complaints filed by consumers, state and local governments .
 We offer a wireless voice and data service primarily using our MVNO rights to provide the service over Verizon’s wireless network . MVNOs are subject to many of the same FCC regulations as facilities-based wireless carriers . We have been involved in program access disputes at the FCC and may be subject to new complaints in the future .
 The FCC, the Department of Commerce’s National Telecommunications and Information Administration, and other federal agencies have taken steps to evaluate and potentially modify certain spectrum allocations and rules . We cannot predict the timing or outcome of these spectrum allocation actions . We could be required to transition our operations to different frequencies in order to accommodate the reallocation of spectrum for 5G, which could disrupt our services and impose additional costs .
 U.S. copyright laws establish a cable compulsory copyright license that requires our video distribution business to contribute a specified percentage of revenue to a federal copyright royalty pool in exchange for retransmitting copyrighted material . We also pay standard industry licensing fees for the public performance of music in the programs we create or distribute . The extent of copyright protection is sometimes ambiguous and the use of technological protections can be controversial .
 In the United States, federal privacy laws restrict companies’ collection, use, disclosure and retention of personal information . The proliferation of laws at the state level has expanded consumers’ rights to include individual rights of access, deletion, portability, correction, the right to appeal, and the individual’s right to “opt in” to collection and use of certain types of “sensitive” personal information.
 There has been an increased focus on children’s privacy at both the state and federal levels within the U.S. and internationally . These new laws may require changes to our products and services and could adversely affect our advertising businesses . In some situations, DBS providers and other competitors (such as DTC streaming service providers) that deliver their services over a broadband connection do not face the same state and local tax and fee burdens .
 The Internet Tax Freedom Act prohibits most states and localities from imposing sales and other taxes on our internet access charges and discriminating against electronic commerce . Other aspects of our businesses include our Studios and Theme Parks businesses, accessibility to our video and voice services and broadcast television programming for people with disabilities . In addition, our international businesses are subject to various similar regulations, including those that cover television broadcasting, programming, and advertising .
 Approximately 30% of our employees were located in over 30 countries outside the United States, with larger workforce concentrations in the United Kingdom, Western Europe, East Asia and South Asia . A small portion of our full-time U.S. employees are unionized, although many of Content & Experiences’ freelance and temporary writers, directors, actors, technical and production perverselysonnel, as well as some on-air and creative talent employees, are covered by industry-wide collective bargaining agreements .
 Comcast has nine voluntary employee resource groups with more than 36,000 members in 240 chapters across the U.S. These employee-led organizations are open to all and contribute to business priorities, career development, and foster an inclusive and collaborative workplace . We provide a wide variety of opportunities for professional growth for all employees with in-classroom and online trainings .
 Employers focus on attracting and retaining employees by providing compensation and benefits packages that are competitive within the applicable market, taking into account the job position’s location and responsibilities . We offer comprehensive family planning options, including for adoption and surrogacy, and provide specialized support teams to help employees manage all stages in the family planning journey including parenthood .
